title: Chinese Embassy and Cuba Ministry of Foreign Trade and Foreign Investment jointly hold human resources training seminar
description: On 20 November, 2017, the Economic and Commercial Counseling Office of the Chinese Embassy in Cuba as well as the Ministry of Foreign Trade and Foreign Investment of Cuba jointly organized a human resources training seminar for Cuban Government officials. Both organizations exchanged and discussed performance evaluation, opinions, and suggestions with the Cuban Government trainees.  Counselor Hong Xiao and Director Wang Lin of the Performance Evaluation Working Group of the Ministry of Commerce and his delegation attended the seminar on behalf of the Chinese Government. A combination of representatives and trainees attended the meeting on behalf of Cuba.
staff_comments: Stage 2 coder could not find new information about this project.
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
Chinese Embassy and Cuba Ministry of Foreign Trade and Foreign Investment jointly hold human resources training seminar

# Description
On 20 November, 2017, the Economic and Commercial Counseling Office of the Chinese Embassy in Cuba as well as the Ministry of Foreign Trade and Foreign Investment of Cuba jointly organized a human resources training seminar for Cuban Government officials. Both organizations exchanged and discussed performance evaluation, opinions, and suggestions with the Cuban Government trainees.  Counselor Hong Xiao and Director Wang Lin of the Performance Evaluation Working Group of the Ministry of Commerce and his delegation attended the seminar on behalf of the Chinese Government. A combination of representatives and trainees attended the meeting on behalf of Cuba.
justification: Project focuses on human resources training and government capacity building without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Human resources training seminar for government officials, focus on performance evaluation and capacity building

title: Chinese government grants 1 million USD for Hurricane Irma relief efforts
description: On October 26, 2017, the Chinese government signed, among other agreements, a grant for 1 million USD to be used to help the recovery of areas affected by Hurricane Irma. The document was signed by the Cuban Minister of Foreign Trade and Investment and the Chinese ambassador to Cuba.
staff_comments: Judgement call made to separate this project from project #55742, a 1 million USD grant from Beijing Enterprises Group Company Ltd.; 'China and Cuba Strengthen Trade Ties' explicitly reports that the two projects are the same. However, '集团捐款100万美元用于古巴飓风后重建,' which reports on the grant found in 55742, is dated September 26, 2017, while 'China, Cuba sign agreements to expand economic, trade ties,' which reports on the Chinese Government 1 million USD grant, is dated October 26, 2017.'Irma pummels Cuban economy' explicitly lists the Beijing Enterprises Group and Chinese government grants as separate amounts, and '集团捐款100万美元用于古巴飓风后重建' makes no mention of granting the funds on behalf of the Chinese government.
combined_text:
# Sector
EMERGENCY RESPONSE

# Title
Chinese government grants 1 million USD for Hurricane Irma relief efforts

# Description
On October 26, 2017, the Chinese government signed, among other agreements, a grant for 1 million USD to be used to help the recovery of areas affected by Hurricane Irma. The document was signed by the Cuban Minister of Foreign Trade and Investment and the Chinese ambassador to Cuba.
justification: Humanitarian aid for disaster relief with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Grant for Hurricane Irma relief efforts, focused on recovery and humanitarian aid

title: Chinese Consulate-General donates sport equipment for the 2017 CARIFTA Games
description: On January 14, 2017, the Chinese Consulate-General in Willemstad donated sports equipment to Curacao to support the 2017 CARIFTA Games. The donation included track and field equipment, such as a bar for pole vaulting. The handover ceremony was held at the Ergilio Hato Stadium. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.

On January 14, 2017, the Chinese Consulate-General in Willemstad donated sports equipment to Curacao to support the 2017 CARIFTA Games. The donation included track and field equipment, such as a bar for pole vaulting. The handover ceremony was held at the Ergilio Hato Stadium. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.

title: Chinese Government donates 500,000 tons of crude oil in 2017
description: In 2017, the Chinese Government donated approximately 500,000 tons of crude oil to the North Korean Government. 500,000 tons of oil is equivalent to 3,665,000 barrels of oil. Therefore, to estimate the monetary value of this donation ($186,182,000), AidData has taken the average price ($50.80) of a barrel of West Texas Intermediate (NYMEX) crude oil in 2017 and multiplied it by 3,665,000 barrels of oil. This crude oil donation project was supported via recurring grants from China’s Ministry of Commerce (MOFCOM) between 2000 and 2017.  Since 1991, China has been North Korea's largest crude oil provider, making up 80% of its supply. Crude oil is provided to North Korea through a pipeline (known as the Dandong-Sinuiju Pipeline or Friendship Oil Pipeline) from the Daqing Oil Field, 800 kilometers north of the China-North Korea border. The pipeline, which was completed in December 1975, runs for more than 30 km from storage facilities in the Chinese border city of Dandong to an oil depot in Sinuiju in North Korea. It supplies approximately 520,000 tons (3.64 million barrels) of heavy crude oil each year, according to its operator, China National Petroleum Corporation (CNPC). Once across the border, the crude oil is processed at North Korea's sole working refinery, the Ponghwa Chemical Factory, a facility built with Chinese assistance during the 1970s. The refinery turns the oil into refined products for North Korea's government, military, transport, agricultural and fishing sectors.  China’s provision of oil to North Korea — through the Dandong-Sinuiju Pipeline (or ‘Friendship Oil Pipeline’) — was exempted from the sanctions that the United Nations Security Council imposed on North Korea in 2017.
staff_comments: 1. In 2012, a North Korean source disclosed that every year ‘the Ministry of Commerce of China and the North Korean government will discuss the catalogue of aid products, quantity, period, etc., but it is basically 100,000 tons of grain, 500,000 tons of oil, and materials needed by North Korea worth 20 million US dollars.’  This annual oil donation arrangement between the Chinese Government and the North Korean Government dates back to the 1970s. On October 17, 1970, the Chinese Government and the Government of North Korea signed an Agreement on Mutual Supply of Critical Materials 1971-1976. Under the terms of this agreement, the Chinese Government agreed to provide the North Korean Government with 500,000 tons of crude oil per year.
combined_text:
# Sector
INDUSTRY, MINING, CONSTRUCTION

# Title
Chinese Government donates 500,000 tons of crude oil in 2017

# Description
In 2017, the Chinese Government donated approximately 500,000 tons of crude oil to the North Korean Government. 500,000 tons of oil is equivalent to 3,665,000 barrels of oil. Therefore, to estimate the monetary value of this donation ($186,182,000), AidData has taken the average price ($50.80) of a barrel of West Texas Intermediate (NYMEX) crude oil in 2017 and multiplied it by 3,665,000 barrels of oil. This crude oil donation project was supported via recurring grants from China’s Ministry of Commerce (MOFCOM) between 2000 and 2017.  Since 1991, China has been North Korea's largest crude oil provider, making up 80% of its supply. Crude oil is provided to North Korea through a pipeline (known as the Dandong-Sinuiju Pipeline or Friendship Oil Pipeline) from the Daqing Oil Field, 800 kilometers north of the China-North Korea border. The pipeline, which was completed in December 1975, runs for more than 30 km from storage facilities in the Chinese border city of Dandong to an oil depot in Sinuiju in North Korea. It supplies approximately 520,000 tons (3.64 million barrels) of heavy crude oil each year, according to its operator, China National Petroleum Corporation (CNPC). Once across the border, the crude oil is processed at North Korea's sole working refinery, the Ponghwa Chemical Factory, a facility built with Chinese assistance during the 1970s. The refinery turns the oil into refined products for North Korea's government, military, transport, agricultural and fishing sectors.  China’s provision of oil to North Korea — through the Dandong-Sinuiju Pipeline (or ‘Friendship Oil Pipeline’) — was exempted from the sanctions that the United Nations Security Council imposed on North Korea in 2017.
justification: Project involves donation of crude oil, a fossil fuel, and is part of ongoing oil supply infrastructure
evidence: 500,000 tons of crude oil donation, Dandong-Sinuiju Pipeline infrastructure, supply of heavy crude oil to North Korea

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 519 million grant for Central African Culture and Art Center Construction Project
description: As part of an economic and technical cooperation agreement (ETCA) signed on December 17, 2017, the Chinese Government committed to provide a grant to finance the the Central African Culture and Art Center Construction Project. This project is worth 519 million RMB.  This project involves two parts: the construction of the Central African Cultural Center and the National Academy of Arts in Kinshasa. The project also involves the construction of the guard house, reception room, square, road, parking lot, fence and other auxiliary facilities. The construction scale is about 37008.44 square meters, including a 2000-seat grand theater, 800-seat small theater and a National Academy of Arts campus that can accommodate 2000 students.  Beijing Urban Construction Group is the contractor responsible for implementation of the project. On August 21, 2018, the project implementation agreement was signed by representatives of China's Ministry of Commerce and Congo's Minister of Foreign Affairs. Construction began on October 15, 2019. The Chinese Ambassador to the DRC, Zhu Jing, visited the project site on January 23, 2023 and announced that the project was expected to reach completion by the end of 2023.
staff_comments: 1. The French project title is Construction d'un centre culturel pour les pays de l’Afrique Centrale. The Chinese project title is 金沙萨中部非洲国家文化艺术中心项目 or 援刚果（金）金沙萨中部非洲国家文化艺术中心项目.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
Chinese Government provides RMB 519 million grant for Central African Culture and Art Center Construction Project

# Description
As part of an economic and technical cooperation agreement (ETCA) signed on December 17, 2017, the Chinese Government committed to provide a grant to finance the the Central African Culture and Art Center Construction Project. This project is worth 519 million RMB.  This project involves two parts: the construction of the Central African Cultural Center and the National Academy of Arts in Kinshasa. The project also involves the construction of the guard house, reception room, square, road, parking lot, fence and other auxiliary facilities. The construction scale is about 37008.44 square meters, including a 2000-seat grand theater, 800-seat small theater and a National Academy of Arts campus that can accommodate 2000 students.  Beijing Urban Construction Group is the contractor responsible for implementation of the project. On August 21, 2018, the project implementation agreement was signed by representatives of China's Ministry of Commerce and Congo's Minister of Foreign Affairs. Construction began on October 15, 2019. The Chinese Ambassador to the DRC, Zhu Jing, visited the project site on January 23, 2023 and announced that the project was expected to reach completion by the end of 2023.
justification: Project focuses on cultural and educational infrastructure without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Construction of cultural center and arts academy, including theaters and educational facilities, with auxiliary infrastructure

title: Chinese Government provides grant for Monsanto (Monsango) School Activity Center Project
description: On October 7, 2017, the Chinese Government conducted the handover of the Monsanto (Monsango) School Activity Center in Kinshasa, DRC that it funded. It is unknown when construction began for the project, as well as the value of Chinese financing provided for the project. This project is completed.

title: Chinese Government supports establishment of Confucius Institute at Congolese Diplomatic Academy
description: On December 21, 2017, the Chinese Government committed to establish a Confucius Institute in the Democratic Republic of Congo. It was officially co-established by the Congolese Diplomatic Academy (also known as the DRC Foreign Affairs University) and Central South University of China on August 21, 2018. It is the first Confucius Institute in the DRC. The monetary value of the grant commitment for this project is unknown. This project is completed.

It is the first Confucius Institute in the DRC. The monetary value of the grant commitment for this project is unknown. This project is completed.

title: [Sino-Congolese Programme] China Eximbank provides funding for technical studies of Goma Stadium Rehabilitation Project (Linked to Project ID#450, #59211)
description: In 2008, China Eximbank issued a $3 billion line of credit to Sino–Congolais des Mines (Sicomines SARL) — a joint venture — to finance infrastructure projects in the DRC (see Project ID#450). All borrowings through this line of credit (framework agreement) are repaid with revenues from mining projects managed by Sicomines SARL. Each subsidiary loan issued through the line of credit carries a maturity of 25 years, a grace period of 10 years, and an interest rate of 6-month LIBOR plus a 1% margin (or 3.839% at the time of the agreement). The infrastructure projects that are supported by this line of credit are collectively referred to as the ‘Sino-Congolese Programme’.   One of the subsidiary projects under the ‘Sino-Congolese Programme’ was the funding of the technical studies to assess cracks developed on the construction site of the Goma stadium project in collaboration with Goma Volcanological Observatory. The study was completed in 2017 and resulted in the request for $1,500,000 of additional funding through the Sino-Congolese Programme for treatment of the cracks.   Democratic Republic of Congo Agence Congolaise des Grands Travaux (ACGT) was the implementing agency along with Observatoire Volcanologique de Goma. The nature of the financial commitment for the technical studies is unknown. The stadium was completed on January 19, 2022.
staff_comments: 1. The French name for this project is Etudes de diagnostic des fissures développées sur le chantier du projet du stade de Goma en collaboration avec Observatoire Volcanologique de Goma. 2. The Goma Stadium Construction Project is captured via Project ID#59211.
combined_text:

All borrowings through this line of credit (framework agreement) are repaid with revenues from mining projects managed by Sicomines SARL. Each subsidiary loan issued through the line of credit carries a maturity of 25 years, a grace period of 10 years, and an interest rate of 6-month LIBOR plus a 1% margin (or 3.839% at the time of the agreement). The infrastructure projects that are supported by this line of credit are collectively referred to as the ‘Sino-Congolese Programme’.   One of the subsidiary projects under the ‘Sino-Congolese Programme’ was the funding of the technical studies to assess cracks developed on the construction site of the Goma stadium project in collaboration with Goma Volcanological Observatory. The study was completed in 2017 and resulted in the request for $1,500,000 of additional funding through the Sino-Congolese Programme for treatment of the cracks.   Democratic Republic of Congo Agence Congolaise des Grands Travaux (ACGT) was the implementing agency along with Observatoire Volcanologique de Goma.
